Literature Review: Personalized therapeutics for KATP-dependent pathologies have emerged as a promising approach to treat a range of monogenic disorders. The unique assembly of Kir6 pore-forming subunits and sulfonylurea receptor (SUR) subunits in ATP-sensitive potassium (KATP) channels underlies the diverse spectrum of pathologies resulting from gain- or loss-of-function mutations. This review aims to provide an overview of KATP channel physiology, pathology, and pharmacology, with a focus on the potential for more specific or effective therapeutic agents.
